South side's delegation to tenth inter-Korean ministerial talks here 
    Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- South side's delegation with minister of unification Jong Se Hyon as chief delegate arrived in Pyongyang today to participate in the 10th north-south ministerial talks.
 The delegation was greeted by north side's delegates to the talks at the airport.

articles.content:
Thai Prime Minister on friendly relations with DPRK 
    Pyongyang, April 26 (KCNA) -- The Thai government and people will make positive efforts to develop the friendly and cooperative relations between Thailand and the DPRK in the future.
 Thai Prime Minister Thaksin Shinawatra said this when meeting the DPRK Ambassador to his country who paid a farewell call on him on April 21.    
 The prime minister noted with satisfaction that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries have successfully developed in recent years. The visit of President of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK Kim Yong Nam to Thailand last year was a very significant one as it was the visit paid by a high-level delegation, he said. The agreements signed between the two countries are legally guaranteeing the friendly and cooperative relations.

articles.content:
Greetings to South African President
    Pyongyang, April 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, sent a message of greetings to Thabo Mvuyelwa Mbeki, President of South Africa, on April 17 on the occasion of its National Day.
 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger, the message wished the president and people of South Africa greater success in the work for peace and progress of the country.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Togo
articles.content:
Greetings to Sierra Leonean President
    Pyongyang, April 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Al Haji Ahmad Tejan Kabbah, President of Sierra Leone, on April 17 on the occasion of the 42nd anniversary of the independence of his country.
 Expressing the belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would continue to develop favorably, the message wholeheartedly  wished him and his people  greater success in the work for the peace of the country and national reconciliation.

articles.title: DPRK Foreign Ministry's delegation leaves
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Togo
    Pyongyang, April 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, today sent a message of greetings to Gnassingbe Eyadema, President of Togo, on the occasion of the 43rd anniversary of its independence.
 Expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to develop on good terms, the message sincerely wished the president and people of Togo greater success in their work for the prosperity of the country.
